snippet: In its biggest move yet to become a national force in refining and selling gasoline, the Tosco Corporation said yesterday that it had agreed to buy all the refining and marketing assets of the Unocal Corporation for about $1.4 billion.    For Unoc...
lead_paragraph: In its biggest move yet to become a national force in refining and selling gasoline, the Tosco Corporation said yesterday that it had agreed to buy all the refining and marketing assets of the Unocal Corporation for about $1.4 billion. For Unocal, which has been using the Union 76 brand name since the 1930's, the deal will mean leaving its West Coast gasoline retailing operations to focus almost exclusively on exploration and production.
abstract: Tosco Corp says it agreed to buy all the refining and marketing assets of Unocal Corp for $1.4 billion; Unocal, which has used Union 76 brand name since 1930's, will focus almost exclusively on exploration and production; Tosco, the dominant East Coast refiner, would gain Unocal's California refineries to become nation's largest independent refiner; Tosco would also become third-largest retailer of gasoline in California; Tosco says it will upgrade some gas stations carrying Union 76 brand by adding convenience stores; Tosco's chairman, Thomas D O'Malley, says he does not foresee labor cutbacks in either gas stations or refineries; graph (M)

headline.main: Unocal to Sell Gas Stations To Tosco
